reviews.name: M
reviews.comment: Great new little park in the West End.  It has swings, a fountain, walking paths and games such as Foose ball and ping-pong.  The park has ample seating for people to take a break from their afternoon adventures.   It has charging stations for your electronics and it has overhead fans in some places so you can cool off.  It is beautifully landscaped and it has dedicated areas near the front of the park as pet relief areas. +19

reviews.name: Samuel Reed
reviews.comment: The walking tracks were smooth and clean. Many people were jogging and exercising, creating a healthy vibe.

reviews.name: Fil Lorinc
reviews.comment: Really

reviews.name: Matthew Walker
reviews.comment: This isn't so much a review as a warning so I'm giving it 5 stars due to it being a park: the charging stations do not work, be warned.

reviews.name: Ola Nesgovorov
reviews.comment: Very nice and clean park with lots of places to sit and enjoy the weather

reviews.name: Paula Dodd Barnes
reviews.comment: A great square space of old days in the Dallas West End. Industry's used to thrive here. Now people are walking and living right here all around.

reviews.name: Joanna Serrano
reviews.comment: Great historic location in downtown! +5

reviews.name: Andrew Boggs
reviews.comment: Very clean little park in the middle of everything that would be perfect for eating lunch or reading a book.

reviews.name: Mindy P
reviews.comment: Really nice place with swings, foosball, ping pong, bags, tables/chairs, grassy area.

reviews.name: Codie Angle
reviews.comment: This park is a welcome addition to the neighborhood! The unique water feature and the relaxing swings are wonderful. I look forward to spending lots of time here. The electricity outlets will be helpful if you are looking for a change of scenery while working from home!

reviews.name: Richie Morales
reviews.comment: What a lively place & an area with an endless array of restaurants, bars & venues!

reviews.name: Dena Sims
reviews.comment:
I was walking down Market Street in downtown Dallas.  I stumbled upon a street park nestled between a few buildings. It's about a block in area, but it holds lots of beauty.

I sat and admired the beautiful contents. Trees, lilies, flowers.  It also has a water table with water spurting upward. Suddenly and unexpectedly,  the water became misty and i was sprayed eith the coolness of the mist. I gasped.

There are swings and plenty of seating for the many visitors. The swings were occupied with, what seem like, lovers enjoying each others company.

Late evenings, the sun is perched behind a 5 story apartment building. The air is cool. The park is inviting as many visitors stopped by to admire its beauty.

The park has a calming effect on me and I'm sure others. I could sit for hours. I sat for hours.

It's a wonder.

reviews.name: Carrie Wolford
reviews.comment: er, relaxing little park in the trendy West End.

reviews.name: rufus says calm down
reviews.comment: Great park with tables with power outlets to work on your laptop or recharge your phone. Ping pong and foosball tables. A zen zone with a fountain. There were apparently porch swings

reviews.name: Remsen Jennings
reviews.comment: This will be a fantastic new addition to the West End. There are far too many parking lots in Downtown Dallas so this park was a great way to replace an old parking lot with something the community can enjoy all year. This is also close to the new Dallas Holocaust and Humans Rights Museum. Exciting times in this neighborhood!

reviews.name: Jessica Johnson
reviews.comment: Love this new park just minutes from the office. Soooo many seating options and feels very spacious. Super cute swing seats!

reviews.name: C Curtis
reviews.comment: Great park! Cool idea for a park in the city. My son and I had a great time on the foosball and table tennis games!

reviews.name: Alexis Granados
reviews.comment: Beautiful addition to the west end! Love that it has bean bag toss, foosball and pingpong! Also the swinging chair and benches are so relaxing

reviews.name: Oscar Vega
reviews.comment: Great new park, stopped with the family while walking all around downtown, Spent a good time playing ping pong

reviews.comment: It's REALLY nice! Bring an extra ping-pong ball and some quarters for Foosball & you'll be set!

reviews.comment: Nice, relaxing place in the middle of a lot of Dallas. Chairs, benches, and fountains. No restrooms.
